title: Iran says it's curbing uranium enrichment
contentencoded: The news from the Tehran and the United Nations today is that Iran has stopped its most sensitive uranium enrichment work. It's part of a deal with world powers to ease worry about the country's nuclear program. It also clears the way for a partial lifting of sanctions. To hear more about this story from the BBC's Matthew Price, click the audio player above.

itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, January 20, 2014
description: As part of a deal with world powers, Iran says it has begun suspending its nuclear program.
teaser: As part of a deal with world powers, Iran says it has begun suspending its nuclear program.
